required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of GSK Biological Pandemic Candidate Influenza Vaccine (H1N1) in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Immunogenicity Study of GSK Biologicals' Pandemic Influenza Candidate Vaccine (GSK2340272A) in Children Aged 3 to 9 Years

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity study of GSK Biologicals' pandemic influenza candidate vaccine (GSK2340272A) in children aged 3 to 9 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Haemagglutination Inhibition (HI) Antibody Titers Against Vaccine H1N1 Antigen
primary_outcome.description: Humoral immune response in terms of vaccine H1N1 haemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibodies against A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)v-like virus (Flu A/CAL/7/09) has been assessed. Antibody titers were presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects for HI Antibodies
primary_outcome.description: A seropositive subject was defined as a subject with a serum HI titer equal to or above (≥) 1:10. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroconverted Subjects in Terms of HI Antibodies
primary_outcome.description: Seroconversion (SCR) was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects [pre-vaccination titer below (<) 1:10], a post-vaccination titer ≥ 1:40. For initially seropositive subjects (pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10), at least a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination titer. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for HI Antibodies
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with a serum HI titer ≥ 1:40, which is usually accepted as indicating protection. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Increase (GMFR) for Serum HI Antibody Titer
primary_outcome.description: GMFR, also called seroconversion factor (SCF), was defined as the fold increase in serum HI geometric mean titers (GMTs) post-vaccination compared to pre-vaccination. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects for HI Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: A seropositive subject was defined as a subject with a serum HI titer equal to or above (≥) 1:10. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.

secondary_outcome.measure: HI Antibody Titers Against Vaccine H1N1 Antigen
secondary_outcome.description: Humoral immune response in terms of vaccine H1N1 haemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibodies against A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)v-like virus (Flu A/CAL/7/09) has been assessed. Antibody titers were presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroconverted Subjects in Terms of HI Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Seroconversion (SCR) was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects (pre-vaccination titer below < 1:10), a post-vaccination titer ≥ 1:40. For initially seropositive subjects (pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10), at least a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination titer. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for HI Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with a serum HI titer ≥ 1:40, which is usually accepted as indicating protection. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Increase (GMFR) for Serum HI Antibody Titer
secondary_outcome.description: GMFR, also called seroconversion factor (SCF), was defined as the fold increase in serum HI geometric mean titers (GMTs) post-vaccination compared to pre-vaccination. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 pain (children below 6 years of age) = cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 pain (children above 6 years of age) = significant pain at rest; pain that prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm) of injection site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability, loss of appetite and fever [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 drowsiness = drowsiness which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 irritability = crying that could not be comforted/prevented normal activity. Grade 3 loss of appetite = not eating at all. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as causally related to the vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal, headache and temperature [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 = symptom which prevented normal everyday activity. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as causally related to the vaccination. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Medically-attended Events (MAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Month 0 up to Month 12)
secondary_outcome.description: MAEs were defined as events for which the subject received medical attention defined as hospitalization, an emergency room visit, or a visit to or from medical personnel (medical doctor) for any reason. Any MAE(s) = Occurrence of any MAE(s) regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events of Specific Interest (AESIs)/Potential Immune-mediated Disease (pIMDs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Month 0 up to Month 12)
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events of specific interest (AESI) were defined as AEs including autoimmune diseases and other mediated inflammatory disorders and assessed by the investigator as specific to the treatment administration. Potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) are a subset of AEs that include autoimmune diseases and other inflammatory and/or neurologic disorders of interest which may or may not have an autoimmune aetiology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Month 0 to Month 12)
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

arm_group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes that their parent(s)/Legally Acceptable Representative(s) (LAR) can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- Children, male or female, aged between 3 and 9 years at the time of first study vaccination.
- Written informed consent obtained from the parent(s) or LAR(s) of the subject.
- Healthy children, as established by medical history and clinical examination when entering the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product other than the study vaccine within 30 days preceding the first dose of the study vaccine or planned use during the study period.
- Clinically or virologically confirmed influenza infection within six months preceding the study start.
- Planned administration of any vaccine 30 days prior and 30 days after any study vaccine administration.
- Have received any seasonal flu vaccine since last year.
- Previous administration of any H1N1 A/California-like vaccine
- Chronic administration of immunosuppressants or other immune-modifying drugs within three months prior to enrolment in this study or planned administration during the study period. For corticosteroids, this will mean prednisone >= 0.5 mg/kg/day, or equivalent. Inhaled and topical steroids are allowed.
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition, based on medical history and physical examination.
- Acute or chronic, clinically-significant pulmonary, cardiovascular, hepatic or renal functional abnormality, as determined by medical history and physical examination.
- History of hypersensitivity to vaccines.
- History of allergic disease or reactions likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccines.
- History of any neurological disorders or seizures.
- Acute disease and/or fever at the time of enrolment:
- Fever is defined as temperature >= 37.5°C on oral, axillary or tympanic setting, or >= 38°C on rectal setting.
- Subjects with a minor illness (such as mild diarrhoea, mild upper respiratory infection) without fever may be enrolled at the discretion of the investigator.
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products within the three months prior to the enrolment in this study, or planned during the study.
- Any condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, renders the subject unfit for participation in the study.
- Child in Care.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: From a total of 60 subjects enrolled in the study only 58 were vaccinated.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Haemagglutination Inhibition (HI) Antibody Titers Against Vaccine H1N1 Antigen
outcome.description: Humoral immune response in terms of vaccine H1N1 haemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibodies against A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)v-like virus (Flu A/CAL/7/09) has been assessed. Antibody titers were presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects who received 2 doses of study vaccine and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against H1N1 antigen for any blood sample taken up to Month 7 after first vaccine dose.

outcome.description: Seroconversion (SCR) was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects (pre-vaccination titer below < 1:10), a post-vaccination titer ≥ 1:40. For initially seropositive subjects (pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10), at least a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination titer. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects who received 2 doses of study vaccine and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against H1N1 antigen for any blood sample taken up to Month 7 after first vaccine dose.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F2 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

measure.title: Number of Seroconverted Subjects in Terms of HI Antibodies
measure.description: Seroconversion (SCR) was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects (pre-vaccination titer below < 1:10), a post-vaccination titer ≥ 1:40. For initially seropositive subjects (pre-vaccination titer ≥ 1:10), at least a 4-fold increase in post-vaccination titer. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects who received 2 doses of study vaccine and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against H1N1 antigen for any blood sample taken up to Month 7 after first vaccine dose.

outcome.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for HI Antibodies
outcome.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with a serum HI titer ≥ 1:40, which is usually accepted as indicating protection. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects who received 2 doses of study vaccine and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against H1N1 antigen for any blood sample taken up to Month 7 after first vaccine dose.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F2 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

measure.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for HI Antibodies
measure.description: A seroprotected subject was defined as a vaccinated subject with a serum HI titer ≥ 1:40, which is usually accepted as indicating protection. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects who received 2 doses of study vaccine and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against H1N1 antigen for any blood sample taken up to Month 7 after first vaccine dose.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Fold Increase (GMFR) for Serum HI Antibody Titer
outcome.description: GMFR, also called seroconversion factor (SCF), was defined as the fold increase in serum HI geometric mean titers (GMTs) post-vaccination compared to pre-vaccination. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects who received 2 doses of study vaccine and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against H1N1 antigen for any blood sample taken up to Month 7 after first vaccine dose.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F2 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 9 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Fold Increase (GMFR) for Serum HI Antibody Titer
measure.description: GMFR, also called seroconversion factor (SCF), was defined as the fold increase in serum HI geometric mean titers (GMTs) post-vaccination compared to pre-vaccination. The flu strain assessed was Flu A/CAL/7/09.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects who received 2 doses of study vaccine and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against H1N1 antigen for any blood sample taken up to Month 7 after first vaccine dose.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 pain (children below 6 years of age) = cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 pain (children above 6 years of age) = significant pain at rest; pain that prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Y6-9 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F2 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F2 Y6-9 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Y6-9 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
measure.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 pain (children below 6 years of age) = cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 pain (children above 6 years of age) = significant pain at rest; pain that prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 50 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability, loss of appetite and fever [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 drowsiness = drowsiness which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 irritability = crying that could not be comforted/prevented normal activity. Grade 3 loss of appetite = not eating at all. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as causally related to the vaccination
outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F2 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

measure.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability, loss of appetite and fever [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 drowsiness = drowsiness which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 irritability = crying that could not be comforted/prevented normal activity. Grade 3 loss of appetite = not eating at all. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as causally related to the vaccination
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

class.title: Any Loss of appetite, Across doses
Grade 3 Loss of appetite, Across doses
Related Loss of appetite, Across doses

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal, headache and temperature [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 = symptom which prevented normal everyday activity. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as causally related to the vaccination. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C.

outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

measure.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal, headache and temperature [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = incidence of a particular symptom regardless of intensity grade or relationship to vaccinations. Grade 3 = symptom which prevented normal everyday activity. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as causally related to the vaccination. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Medically-attended Events (MAEs)
outcome.description: MAEs were defined as events for which the subject received medical attention defined as hospitalization, an emergency room visit, or a visit to or from medical personnel (medical doctor) for any reason. Any MAE(s) = Occurrence of any MAE(s) regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Month 0 up to Month 12)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Y3-5 Group

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Medically-attended Events (MAEs)
measure.description: MAEs were defined as events for which the subject received medical attention defined as hospitalization, an emergency room visit, or a visit to or from medical personnel (medical doctor) for any reason. Any MAE(s) = Occurrence of any MAE(s) regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events of Specific Interest (AESIs)/Potential Immune-mediated Disease (pIMDs)
outcome.description: Adverse events of specific interest (AESI) were defined as AEs including autoimmune diseases and other mediated inflammatory disorders and assessed by the investigator as specific to the treatment administration. Potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) are a subset of AEs that include autoimmune diseases and other inflammatory and/or neurologic disorders of interest which may or may not have an autoimmune aetiology.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Month 0 up to Month 12)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Y6-9 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F2 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F2 Y6-9 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 2 (F2) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

group.title: GSK2340272A F3 Y6-9 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 6 and 9 years of age (Y6-9) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 3 (F3) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events of Specific Interest (AESIs)/Potential Immune-mediated Disease (pIMDs)
measure.description: Adverse events of specific interest (AESI) were defined as AEs including autoimmune diseases and other mediated inflammatory disorders and assessed by the investigator as specific to the treatment administration. Potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) are a subset of AEs that include autoimmune diseases and other inflammatory and/or neurologic disorders of interest which may or may not have an autoimmune aetiology.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

group.title: GSK2340272A F1 Y3-5 Group
group.description: Healthy male or female children, between 3 and 5 years of age (Y3-5) at the time of first study vaccination, who intramuscularly received 2 doses of GSK2340272A vaccine formulation 1 (F1) in the deltoid region of the arm, according to a 0-21 day schedule.

Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Month 0 to Month 12)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least 1 vaccine administration documented.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited local and general symptoms: during the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period. Unsolicited adverse events (AEs): during the 21-day (Days 0-20) post-vaccination period. Serious adverse events (SAEs): from Month 0 up to Month 12.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
